context: The word 'nägid' is the second-person plural past tense form of the Estonian verb 'näema', which means 'to see' or 'to look'. It specifically translates to English as 'you (plural) saw' or 'you all have seen'. In the present tense, it would be 'näete' for you (plural) see/look. The singular past form is 'nägi' (he/she/it saw).
